answers.answer: Good Morning!I have been treated for Graves since October 2007.  My Endo believes I am in remission.  However, he feels I will be Hypo at some point (already leaning in that direction).  Thyroid disease runs in my family (both sides).  My sister has had Hypo T since she was 10 years old (she is now 45).  2 years ago she was diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes.  My Endo told me that all the hormone leves (estrogen, insulin, thyroid) all work together.  When one is out of sync, the others eventually will be too.Since the Hyper part of my Graves disease has slowly starting heading toward Hypo T my cholesterol has started going up.  The Endo has had me go on a high fiber diet.  He checks my cholesterol every 2 months.  At this point, he hasn't put me on cholesterol lowering medication.  He also has me walking everyday (30 minutes at a time).  While I still have days where I feel sluggish, I do feel much better.Eating low carbs and more healthy protein, helps tremendously.My blood pressure has gotten under control (was nothing to read 185/100.  I've always had low normal bp.  It now reads 107/65, 115/72, much better than before.  It still goes up when I go to the doctor (white coat syndrome).  But as soon as I quit walking regularly, things start getting off again.

question: I was diagnosed 6 years ago with Graves and treated with radioactive iodine.  Seemed to do the trick and I went hypo, then treated with levrotyroxine.  6 years later I develop type 2 diabetes.  Both these diseases by different doctors were treated like a cold, take these pills and call me in the morning.  Another words, I was never told how to care for either.  Went I went to the hospital my diabetes #'s were 1000 and my cholesterol was 1200, blood pressure 150 over 98.  They recommended metformin, glipizide, lisinopril, aspirin, and cholesterol meds.  Now, I have low blood sugar down to 30 by the time I treat it, hurting calves all the time and either feel nausea  or crappy all the time.  the Doc can't seem to get them both under control and is constantly testing while I feel like ****.  I am going to see another Endo, but is there any advice out there?
title: graves and type 2 diabetes
